variants.Description in input context: G2019S (p.G839S) mutation in LRRK2 associated with Parkinson's disease
R1441C (p.R1441C) mutation in LRRK2 associated with Parkinson's disease

Material used.Description: HEK293 cells were transfected with wild-type and mutant LRRK2 constructs.

Readout description.Result Description: Increased phosphorylation of LRRK2 at S935 and S1290 in G2019S mutant cells compared to wild-type.
Enhanced kinase activity in R1441C mutant cells, leading to increased phosphorylation of downstream substrates.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent biological replicates were performed.

Technical replicates.Description: Each Western blot was repeated in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type LRRK2 construct was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector transfection served as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA was used to compare phosphorylation levels between groups.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Phosphorylation levels within 10% of wild-type controls.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Phosphorylation levels exceeding 30% of wild-type controls.

Material used.Description: HEK293 cells expressing wild-type or mutant LRRK2 were used to measure kinase activity.

Readout description.Result Description: G2019S mutant showed 2.5-fold increase in kinase activity compared to wild-type.
R1441C mutant exhibited 1.8-fold increase in kinase activity relative to wild-type.

Biological replicates.Description: Two independent biological replicates were performed.

Technical replicates.Description: Each kinase assay was repeated in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type LRRK2 kinase activity was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Kinase-dead LRRK2 (D1341N) mutant served as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Student's t-test was used to compare kinase activity between groups.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Kinase activity within 15% of wild-type controls.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Kinase activity exceeding 40% of wild-type controls.
